item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Saturday, October 12, 2024 at 10:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. AMD's Turin: 5th Gen EPYC Launched (183 points | 66 comments)
2. Switching customers from Linux to BSD because boring is good (50 points | 28 comments)
3. Started a guide to writing FUSE filesystems in Python (201 points | 53 comments)
4. Conway's Gradient of Life (278 points | 24 comments)
5. Lm.rs: Minimal CPU LLM inference in Rust with no dependency (253 points | 60 comments)
6. MSI leaks Ryzen 9000X3D: 2% to 13% higher gaming performance than 7000X3D (44 points | 18 comments)
7. The Society in Dedham for Apprehending Horse Thieves (23 points | 12 comments)
8. "Bad Apple" in Minecraft (272 points | 36 comments)
9. PeachPie Compiler: Compile and run PHP on top of .NET runtime (26 points | 7 comments)
10. The revival of the beach in twentieth-century Los Angeles (22 points | 3 comments)
11. Swarm, a new agent framework by OpenAI (38 points | 5 comments)
12. Show HN: I made a URL expander because short links are too mainstream (152 points | 68 comments)
13. How London's Crystal Palace was built so quickly (51 points | 21 comments)
14. Show HN: Self-Hostable Algolia DocSearch Replacement (34 points | 13 comments)
15. Windows dynamic linking depends on the active code page (114 points | 32 comments)
16. Working from home is powering productivity (461 points | 311 comments)
17. Python and SysV Shared Memory (3 points | discuss)
18. Understanding the Limitations of Mathematical Reasoning in LLMs (203 points | 227 comments)
19. Gboard double-sided version (23 points | 6 comments)
20. Are retrocomputers best left on or off? (55 points | 47 comments)
21. Fundamental physics is dying? [video] (115 points | 154 comments)
22. Show HN: I made an Ollama summarizer for Firefox (84 points | 25 comments)
23. INTELLECT–1: Launching the First Decentralized Training of a 10B Parameter Model (52 points | 13 comments)
24. Google is preparing to let you run Linux apps on Android, just like Chrome OS (126 points | 121 comments)
25. Why do systems fail? Tandem NonStop system and fault tolerance (76 points | 30 comments)
26. Io_uring and seccomp (2022) (67 points | 21 comments)
27. "Begin disabling installed extensions still using Manifest V2 in Chrome stable" (439 points | 400 comments)
28. Run Llama locally with only PyTorch on CPU (152 points | 30 comments)
29. How long til we're all on Ozempic? (354 points | 1228 comments)
30. An exoskeleton let a paralyzed man walk, then its maker refused repairs (169 points | 123 comments)
